subject.geographic: Corner Baronne and Julia Streets, New Orleans, La
Corner Baronne and Julia Streets, New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD will be paid for the arrest and delivery to me of the Girl MILDRED ANN JACKSON, better known as ANN, and the conviction of the person who has harbored her; or FIFTY DOLLARS will be paid for the delivery of the Girl to me. She ran off about the 1st of May. She is a dark mulattress or griffe, tall and good looking, about 26 years old, has straight hair, bad teeth, has a mole on her upper lip. She is a good seamstress and house servant, and is supposed to be harbored in the upper part of the First District. She has lived in the First District about six years, and is well known. F. M. FISK, Corner Baronne and Julia streets. je17 6t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
